bibliography.source_title: Temperature inversion and air pollution relationship, and its effects on human health in Hanoi City, Vietnam
bibliography.source_authors: Trinh, T.T., Trinh, T.T., Le, T.T., Nguyen, T.D.H., Tu, B.M.
bibliography.key_findings: Temperature inversions in Hanoi occur most frequently from November to March. Levels of NO2, SO2, PM10 and PM2.5 increased when inversions strengthened. Statistical analysis showed temperature inversions correlated with concentration of air pollutants over 5 years (2011-2015).

bibliography.source_title: Intricate behavior of winter pollution in Hanoi over the 2006–2020 semi-climatic period
bibliography.source_authors: Phung-Ngoc, B.A., Dieudonné, E., Delbarre, H., Deboudt, K., Nguyen, S.T., Bui, V.H., Vu, D.M., Nguyen-Thi, H.T.
bibliography.key_findings: Long-range transport from China during cold surge onset causes ~30% increase in PM2.5 in Hanoi. Stagnation of local pollution during cold surge persistence causes ~40% increase in PM2.5. Dominant sources switched from biomass burning to industrial activities.

bibliography.source_title: Relationships between the planetary boundary layer height and surface pollutants derived from lidar observations over China: regional pattern and influencing factors
bibliography.source_authors: Su, T., Li, Z., Kahn, R.
bibliography.key_findings: PBLH-PM correlations are roughly negative for most cases. Nonlinearly negative responses of PM to PBLH evolution found over polluted regions. Relatively strong PBLH-PM interactions when PBLH is shallow and PM concentration is high (wintertime). Strong wind with clean upwind air plays dominant role in removing pollutants.

bibliography.source_title: Influence of Northeast Monsoon cold surges on air quality in Southeast Asia
bibliography.source_authors: Ashfold, M.J., Latif, M.T., Samah, A.A., Mead, M.I., Harris, N.R.P.
bibliography.key_findings: Cold surges in November-February transport East Asian pollution to Southeast Asia. CO and O3 elevated by >60% (~80 ppb) and >40% (~15 ppb) respectively during cold surges. Regional exceedances of WHO's O3 guideline often occur during cold surges.

bibliography.source_title: Comparison of dry and wet deposition of particulate matter in near-surface waters during summer
bibliography.source_authors: Wu, Y., Liu, J., Zhai, J., Cong, L., Wang, Y., Ma, W., Zhang, Z., Li, C.
bibliography.key_findings: Wet deposition was more effective in scavenging PM2.5 (92% efficiency). Dry deposition more effective for PM10 (63%). Rain scavenging takes place via Brownian diffusion, inertial impaction, diffusiophoresis, thermophoresis.

bibliography.source_title: Influence of meteorological conditions on PM2.5 and PM2.5−10 concentrations during the monsoon season in Hanoi, Vietnam
bibliography.source_authors: Hien, P.D., Bac, V.T., Tham, H.C., Nhan, D.D., Vinh, L.D.
bibliography.key_findings: Very high PM2.5 and PM2.5-10 concentrations observed with nocturnal radiation inversions (October-December) and subsidence temperature inversions (January-March). Wind speed and air temperature are most important determinants of PM2.5. Meteorological parameters explain 60-74% of day-to-day variations.

relationships.description: Nocturnal surface cooling creates radiation temperature inversion
relationships.mechanism: Nhiệt độ giảm vào ban đêm dẫn đến mặt đất mất nhiệt nhanh hơn không khí phía trên. Lớp không khí sát đất trở nên lạnh hơn lớp trên, tạo ra nghịch nhiệt bức xạ (radiation inversion). Hiện tượng này xảy ra phổ biến nhất từ tháng 10 đến tháng 12 tại Hà Nội.

relationships.description: Anticyclonic high pressure causes subsidence temperature inversion
relationships.mechanism: Điều kiện áp cao (anticyclonic conditions) gây ra hiện tượng lún khí (subsidence) trong khí quyển. Không khí lún xuống bị nén và ấm lên, tạo ra nghịch nhiệt lún (subsidence temperature inversion - STI) ở độ cao thấp. Hiện tượng này phổ biến từ tháng 1 đến tháng 3 tại Hà Nội.
